Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz grabbed his first international goal with a strike that will go down in the history books as his Germany side beat France 2-0.
Wirtz stunned the crowd in Lyon to give Germany the lead on the cusp of seven seconds.
Kai Havertz wrapped up the encounter just after half-time in an impressive display by the Euro 2024 hosts.
Jamal Musiala found Kai Havertz with a long pass, and Havertz slotted the visitors into a two-goal lead.

France nearly halved the deficit in the 88th minute when Mittelstädt mistimed a clearance onto his own arm, but Antonio Rüdiger was on hand to hack the ball off the line and VAR adjudged the handball inside the box to be unintentional.
Post-Match Reflections: France coach Didier Deschamps rang the changes on the hour mark but without Antoine Griezmann, the hosts lacked a cutting edge despite the presence of star striker Kylian Mbappé.
Julian Nagelsmann's charges looked the more likely to score the next goal, with only fine saves by Samba denying debutant Maximilian Mittelstädt and Thomas Müller.
